title: Interactive Learning Design Course for Online Writing Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Basic proficiency in digital devices and foundational writing skills
context.additional_context: Conducted in a limited technological environment centered on smartphones, aiming to improve writing skills linked to real-world tasks for learners in managerial/leadership roles

learning_goals: Learners can apply the three core elements of the CoI (Community of Inquiry) framework—social presence, teaching presence, and cognitive presence—to online writing activities.
Learners can design and implement interactive learning activities using asynchronous discussions, real-time collaborative writing, and webinar chats in a VR-based simulation environment.
Learners can perform a formative assessment process to continuously improve the effectiveness of interactive learning activities by analyzing peer feedback and instructor evaluation data.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
